definition: not able to keep up with
heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Nesta looked off-pace over the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 內斯塔在週末看上去跟不上節奏。

sentences.english: Ribble said Louie wasn't just failing, he was suffering.
sentences.chinese: 裏勃說，路易不只是成績跟不上，而且深感學習辛苦。

sentences.english: If we let the fastest runner set the pace, the others will be left behind.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們讓最快的人定速度，其他人就會跟不上。

sentences.english: Since there are so many deceivers, it is very obvious that idiots are not enough。
sentences.chinese: 騙子太多，傻子的數量明顯跟不上了。

sentences.english: Havin' trouble keeping your power up, General?
sentences.chinese: 你的電力跟不上了嗎，將軍？

sentences.english: He was behind in his studies for his degree, and this worried him.
sentences.chinese: 他要考學位，但成績跟不上，這使他擔憂。

sentences.english: Places like this disappear too fast for maps.
sentences.chinese: 象這樣的地方消失得太快，地圖的更新跟不上。

sentences.english: He was too old to keep pace with the modern ideas of life.
sentences.chinese: 他年紀大了，跟不上現代生活觀念。

sentences.english: Will you slow down? I can’t follow you.
sentences.chinese: 你能說慢點嗎？我跟不上你。

sentences.english: I must turn on the closed captioning .
sentences.chinese: 我跟不上，我必須把字幕機打開了。

sentences.english: Sadly, she added, "the increases in price are not matched by that of salaries in Beijing".
sentences.chinese: 她幽幽的說道，“北京的薪資跟不上這物價的上漲。”

sentences.english: Our bone structure was all wrong, our lung power inadequate.
sentences.chinese: 我們的骨結構不適應，我們的肺活量跟不上。

sentences.english: Your hair joss-stick spreads hurried, I have already canned not keep up with.
sentences.chinese: 你的髮香散得匆忙，我已經跟不上。

sentences.english: But I often find myself struggling to keep up with the information.
sentences.chinese: 但我會發現自己經常跟不上信息的更新節奏。

sentences.english: But they grumble that I'm out of step with the times.
sentences.chinese: 但他們抱怨說，我已經跟不上時代的步伐了。

sentences.english: Walking lame, the old woman couldn't keep pace with her little grandson.
sentences.chinese: 這老太太跛腿行走，跟不上小孫孫的步子。
